result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas C Powell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas C Powell appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Thomas C Powell.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 11-16-22 at 8;30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas C Powell in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Thomas C Powell.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense in need of discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 1:30 pm by zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas C Powell
Current: 205 Danbury Ct, Defrost, WI 53532   (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: 5773 North 96th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant Thomas C Powell in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Thomas C Powell in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thomas C Powell appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with GLA (05/07/1962).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
